intro: Turnera berneriana, commonly known as the golden turnera, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to Central and South America, where it thrives in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. Its botanical features include glandular hairs on the stems and leaves, which contribute to its distinctive appearance. Turnera berneriana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to well-drained soils and full sun exposure.
